answers.answer: Depends what your idea of plus sized is ...I'm chubby but I actually got skinnyer now I'm pregnant my face arms etc are getting smaller but my belly is huge bump and my thighs are bigger too.But I honestly am feeling ok about it I will just have to work hard to slim down after birth... I'm hoping breastfeeding helps.I was tiny on my first pregnancy

I've got cushion everywhere,  but am told that I'm healthy.  But lately sleeping has been difficult because I can't get comfortable.  And I'm sure my growing belly is contributing to my discomfort.  I also plan to breastfeed so I hope that's going to help lol

I have had a healthy pregnancy even though I'm plus sized. I've gained 11 pounds and I'm 37 weeks tomorrow. I'm showing and can see/feel my baby move. My bump isn't the prettiest, but that doesn't bother me as much as it might bother others.

Its just hard to sleep but im a high risk pregnancy because of diabetes and high blood pressure so I have a diet that I have to follow but once I have my baby girl hopefully I can stick to the diet to lose some weight for my health when did you guys start to show I don't even look pregnant and im 21 weeks
I have a consultation for a high risk ob tomorrow.  I had 1 high blood pressure and they referred me lol but I'm sure I'll be fine. But just in case I stay with the high risk dr. What changes? ?

I am plus size, pregnant, with my first baby to and bipolar/depression lol. I will be 5 months tomorrow and this pregnancy has been almost perfect. I barely had morning sickness and i dont crave foods i just eat what i have normally eatin before. I can already feel the baby move like crazy but i did drop 4 pounds my last doctors visit. The only problem i am having now is taken a shower. I get sick every time the water hits me. So hopefully your pregnancy is just as good as mine cause i love it ao far!!

I'm plus sized with baby #2. My first I had to be watched like crazy and went to the dr every two weeks the whole time and had a lot of high blood pressure issues and was induced at 37 weeks for preeclampsia. But this pregnancy I have only gained 8lbs and I'm 30 weeks. I have no issues at all and actually have a real baby bump this time. I'm having a tough time sleeping because I can't get comfy but that's about it.
I feel much better about this, I was scared at first but then I kind of accepted it because I would do anything for my baby

The great this about being plus sized is that you don't have to gain much weight at all. I was 198lbs and my hospital told me not to put on more then 20lbs. However no one told me this with my first and i ate whatever and put on 37lbs but lost it all. The downside is you are more at risk of developing complications so you have to watch your diet and make sure you're getting enough of the right thing. As this is my 2nd time with preeclamplsia my dr has put me on a special diet and I feel great and baby is growing great so far. Definitely talk to your dr about any concerns you have. Good luck!

Im plus sized and pregnant with my first baby:) i am 28 weeks ans 4 days and havent gained any weight yet i actually lost weight bc of my morning sickness in the first trimester but everything is going great for me and baby she is super active!

question: Is anyone else here plus size and pregnant?  If so what are some of your experiences during your pregnancy,  negative or positive.  I'm plus size and am expecting my first baby. It's exciting bit at the same time it's hard having to gain weight when your already scrutinized for being "fluffy" lol any thoughts are welcome!
title: plus sized and pregnant
